			 2013

text.#text: The term

an employee of a local educational agency
				or State educational agency who works in a public school or has a job duty that
				results in exposure to students, including administrators, teachers, substitute
				teachers, custodians, cafeteria workers, and school bus drivers; and

an employee of a company, or a subsidiary
				of a company, that has a contract with a local educational agency or State
				educational agency who works in a public school or has a job duty that results
				in exposure to students.

term.#tail:
means a driving violation that is a felony, as determined by
				State law.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means
				an individual 18 years of age or older who has been convicted of, or pled
				guilty to, a sexual offense against a minor.

text.#text: The term

header.#text:
Background checks for public school
				employees

text.#text:
A local educational agency or State
				educational agency that receives Federal funds shall obtain an FBI background
				check on an individual prior to making an offer of employment as a school
				employee with such agency to such individual.

A local
				educational agency or State educational agency that receives Federal funds may
				not make an offer of employment to an individual for a position as a school
				employee with such agency if such individual has been convicted of a crime of
				violence or other felony.

header.#text:
Prohibition against employment of felons or
				violent criminals

text.#text:
A local educational agency or State
				educational agency that receives information from an FBI background check that
				an individual who has applied for employment with such agency as a school
				employee is a sexual predator shall report to local law enforcement that such
				individual has so applied.

A local educational agency or State
				educational agency that receives Federal funds may not make an offer of
				employment to an individual for a position as a school bus driver if such
				individual has been convicted of, or pled guilty to, drunk driving or a serious
				moving violation.

header.#text:
Loss of Federal funds for failure to
				comply

text.#text:
If a State educational agency fails to take
				an action required under this part or takes an action prohibited under this
				part for—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				withhold from such agency 50 percent of the amount of funds such agency has
				allocated for planning and administrative use under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2113/ss:d

text.#text: 6 months or less, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall withhold from such agency 100 percent of the amount
				of funds such agency has allocated for planning and administrative use under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2113/ss:d

text.#text:
longer than 6 months but not longer than 12
				months, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				withhold from such agency the amount of funds such agency has allocated for
				planning and administrative use under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/t:II

text.#text:
If a State educational
				agency fails to take an action required under this part or takes an action
				prohibited under this part for longer than 12 months, the

may not reallocate Federal funds provided for

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:4403/ss:a/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for planning and administrative use by the
				agency.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/t:II

A State educational agency that fails to
				take an action under this part or takes an action prohibited under this part as

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require all public school employees and
		  those employed in connection with a public school to receive FBI background
		  checks prior to being hired, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions
